column4: hi, i am able to access the internet, but i am unable to access anything on my local network (such as my router) any suggestions?
when you say "access" anything, what do you mean, can't ping your other computers?
I assume you're pinging your router with it's ip address?
ya
does "route -n" list your router's up as the dateway for the destination "0.0.0.0"
yes
If your router is configurable could it just be not responding to pings, what else doesn't work in the local network?
is the laptop running ubuntu as well?
yes
dhcp though
yep or /etc/init.d/networking restart
do the "route -n" outputs on both machines differ alot or at all?
ahhh so the desktop is using a static config in /etc/network/interfaces?
yes
do you mind pasteing your /etc/network/interfaces file in pastebin?
http://pastebin.org/10259
can you humor me and try restarting networking with the auto line before the iface line for eth0?
not sure i quite follow
in your /etc/network/interfaces you have the auto eth1 line at the end, can you move it to line 4?
then restart your networking
sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
that did that trick

beautiful :), so something about the order of those commands had it bring up the interface correctly but not with the right info somehow :) make sure to keep the auto lines above the corresponding iface lines from now on
i greatly appreciate your time, thank you :)
